resources.string: Costa Rica official currency is called \"colon (CRC)\", here you can calculate how much are you going to pay using CRC as base:
Costa Rica is a country with a lot of cultures so you can find world wide food, but this is a list of the most traditional food you must eat
Pinto is the most traditional dish for breakfast (but you can eat it for lunch or dinner as well) It is made of rice and beans mixed up, you can find this all over the country
Meat pot is the a traditional soup made with beef and many vegetables, usually found all over the country
Chifrijo is a traditional dish made of rice, beans, \"Pico de gallo\" (tomato chopped mixed with species) and pork, ocaccionaly served with avocado and chips
A tamale is a corn-based cooked masa that is steamed in either banana leaves. Inside of the masa are fillings that generally include rice, meat, and vegetables.
Rice pudding is a typical dessert made by slowly cooking rice with milk and sugar. It is served hot or cold and cinnamon, vanilla or lemon peel is usually sprinkled on top to flavor it.

Picadillo de chayote is a very traditional Costa Rican recipe that combines the chayote fruit with traditional Costa Rican sofrito, spices, and cream. It is often served as a side dish to the Costa Rican casado, which is a main meal

Chorreadas are basically Costa Rican corn pancakes. They can be sweet or savory, and are made from ground fresh corn. They have similar ingredients to a corn tortilla but the fresh corn and milk give them a completely different texture.

Empanadas are a very popular food in Costa Rica, both because they are easy to make at home, but also because you can buy empanadas on the street in practically every location imaginable. Bean and cheese empanadas (empanada de frijol con queso) are a popular vegetarian type of empanada. Most other empanadas just have a single filling, but the bean and cheese are a fun take on the traditional filling.

The casado is the most traditional Costa Rican lunch- made up of rice, (black) beans, protein, vegetables- all on one plate. Since lunch is the main meal of the day in Costa Rica, the casado is the highlight of Costa Rican cuisine.
Costa Rica Central Bank Service for Exchange Rate unavailable now, please try again later

The Costa Rican vigorón is made from chicharrones (fried pork rinds or pork belly), a cabbage and chimichurri salad and with boiled yuca (cassava) and boiled green plantains in the mix, this dish is usually served cold.

rice and beans is a completely different recipe, as it combines red beans with rice cooked in coconut milk, and spiced with a bit of habanero pepper. The dish is said in English. Over time boiled chicken thighs were added as a side dish, and the result is beyond delicious.

Rice with Chicken is one of the most popular and traditional Costa Rican dishes, It is the official dish in any social event for example at birthday parties. Maybe because it is so simple to make and you can make it in advance so it is conveniently ready when your guest arrive.
This hot drink combines tapa de dulce (Costa Rican brown sugar) and boiling water/milk for a delightful treat.
This Costa Rican ceviche recipe combines fresh white fish marinated in lime, red bell pepper, cilantro, and onion. It’s a favorite worldwide- and the Costa Rican version is to die for.
Churchill is a dessert made up of ice, syrup, condensed milk, powder milk, ice cream and fruits,

Must of the places in Costa Rica takes Credit Cards (specially Visa or MasterCard), cash could be used on public transportations, souvenirs or buying street food. Some places might accept dollars cash on a lower exchange rate, so avoid overpay and try to get money at any local bank or at one ATM
Number too long, please use a lower value
The official national language of Costa Rica is Spanish, however English language, as well as the Portuguese, and many other languages, also are being spoken by a percentage of the population.
This is a kind of bread made out of old and dry baguette, milk, butter and sugar, some people add raisins to it, usually served with condensed milk

Tipping is mandatory at restaurants, 10% tip fee will be charged on your restaurant bill, so you dont need to add any extra amount, but it is up to you. There could be several people that might ask you for a tip for a service (please keep in mind that the minimum monthly wage in Costa Rica is around CRC 360000 if you still want to tip, you can use this as reference) but again it is not mandatory

" As soon as you get to the gas station, you need to wait for a person to help you out to fill up the tank, cash and credit cards are accepted all over the country, Also you will find a lot of Charging Stations for electric cars, and there are 3 different types of gasoline you can get in Costa Rica:"

We highly recommend to visit a \"Soda\" (a small local restaurant) to buy some local dishes at Costa Rica, you will get the best prices on those small restaurants. Prices listed here are an estimated based on how much a costa rican is willing to pay.
Get the premium version to enjoy an ad-free experience.

These little cheese “rosquillas” literally translate to donut in English, but don’t be confused. Found all over Central America, these hard little cookies are the perfect accompaniment to afternoon coffee. You can make the rosquillas either sweet or salty depending on your tastes.
Horchata is a traditional beverage of the northern region of Costa Rica and its sort of creamy texture, It’s very refreshing, a wonderful thirst quencher on a hot day.

Driving in Costa Rica can be a challenge specially at night a lot of places without road marking or without sidewalks so you can find people walking on the street. I really recommend to use an app called \"Waze\" for driving navigation, Google Maps can help you to look for places near your area, but not a good option for driving here.

In Costa Rica you are going to find a bus stop on every single town, you can save a lot of money by using this mean of transportation, on San José, Heredia, Cartago and Alajuela you could use the train as well

A bus will be the cheaper mean of transportation, cash is the main payment method accepted on buses, fares depends on the distance could be between 400CRC up to 9000CRC, if you still want to hire a private shuffle my suggestion will be to use uber to make sure you are getting a good price

There are 3 companies which provide this service Kolbi (this is the local one), Claro and Liberty. You can get a SIM card there use google maps to identify the nearest stores to your area. You can also buy a pre-paid SIM card on almost every supermarket. Using eSIMs or a roaming service from your local provider is also a option here.

Costa Rica’s two\\nseasons are the dry (summer) – from January through April and rainy (winter) from May through December. Temperature in Costa Rica might vary between 16 ° to 36° Celsius. The nearest you are staying to the coast, the highest the temperature will be.

Costa Rica has 12 holidays by year. Some turistic places might increase their prices if there is a holiday coming. Keep these dates on mind while planning your trip:\\n\\nJanuary 1st\\nApril 15th\\nMarch 28th\\nMarch 29th\\nMay 1st\\nJuly 29th\\nAugust 2nd\\nAugust 15th\\nAugust 31st\\nSeptember 15th\\nDecember 1st\\nDecember 25th

It is located on the slopes of the Turrialba Volcano, 19km northeast of the city of the same name, in the province of Cartago.\\n\\nIt is one of the most important and largest archaeological areas that has been discovered in the country. Protects archaeological structures such as roads, mounds, bridges, catchment tanks and aqueducts, among others. In addition, it protects patches of tall evergreen forests typical of the premontane rainforest.
Tickets can be purchased at the entrance with credit or debit cards only
Failed to download the file. Please check your internet connection and try again.

Welcome to the highest peak in Costa Rica. The views are spectacular, on a clear day, you can see the Pacific Ocean and the Caribbean sea simultaneously. This is probably the must challeging hike all over the country.\\n\\nThe schedule time listed before is the minimum time to entry the Park, you can even stay over night if you want.\\n\\nYou will also need to make a reservation through the online park system and an official guide
Rincon de la Vieja National Park
Tickets can be purchased at the entrance with credit or debit cards only
Tickets can be purchased at the entrance with credit or debit cards only

Walking trails surrounded by wildlife and resting on paradisiacal beaches are options that promise to captivate your senses.\\n\\nThe magic of the beach and the greenery of the forest come together in one place, and the result is a natural paradise. Not in vain the Manuel Antonio National Park is the Protected Wild Area that receives the largest number of national and international tourists.\\n\\nIn addition to beaches, the Park offers a very humid tropical forest where species of flora and fauna in danger of extinction coexist, a mangrove, marine environments, islands and a lagoon of 14 hectares.

Whales and dolphins emerge from the water and offer a show that you can witness.\\n\\nInside the park you can visit the tómbolo (whale tail), go and enjoy the beaches or practice superficial and deep diving to see a huge range of marine life. You can also enjoy the calmed sea that bathes these shores or boating on nearby islands.\\n\\nThe Marino Ballena National Park has 4 official access routes for the enjoyment of visitors, all are located by South Inter-American Highway: Uvita, Colonia, Ballena and Piñuela.

You will visit from a dry forest to a cloud one in the midst of a volcanic environment on a short journey.\\n\\nEmanations of boiling mud, boiling water and steam that resonate in the air. You can witness all this volcanic activity and also can visit a dry forest, one wet, one humid and one cloud in just two hours.\\n\\n\"There are unique experiences that you only can live in this park, like visiting the waterfall La Cangreja (known as the \'Blue Lagoon\' due to the characteristic water color), walks through the different environments with stunning ocean views, and the opportunity to witness \'front first row\' some of the forming agents of Costa Rican territory, \"highlighted Luis Alex Garcia, head of tourism in this National Park.

Intertwined history and nature on this site, located in Guanacaste and considered as a World Heritage.\\n\\nScene of the historic Battle of March 20, 1856, the Santa Rosa National Park is the only Protected Wilderness Area that has a historical museum within its territory.\\n\\nAlso found in the park are some of the most ancient lands of Costa Rica, which emerged from the sea over 85 million years ago. \"Among the wealth of tropical dry forest, the diversity of coastal and marine habitats and some of the country\'s history, you can enjoy everything this park has to offer,\" concluded Carrillo.

The grandeur of the volcano is undeniable and this is the first thing you think when visiting La Fortuna de San Carlos, where this natural wonder is located.\\n\\nJuan Diego Vargas, Park tourism operator believes that whoever visit the area should not miss to visit, in addition to the lava flows that fell in 1992, the impressive ceiba tree over 400 years old and trails along extensive and authentic rainforest, where you can appreciate the wildlife and the protected resources of this park.

Being located in the province of Alajuela, it offers visitors easy access from major cities of the country.\\n\\nThis place lets you explore its attractions through a network of trails, especially in a cold climate tempered by a faint drizzle that most of the year is imposed.\\n\\nThe Volcano is active and has one of the largest craters in the world. Know this colossus without traveling long distances.\\n\\nNot only has one of the largest craters in the world, but is located in the forests of Central Mountain Range, which boasts magnificent natural landscapes

The prices listed here are the official rates for adult foreigners; children and locals gets a better fare. book your tickets in advance to avoid paying more to resellers. More information about additional national parks will be added soon. In the meantime, you can visit the official government website at www.sinac.go.cr for more details.
Slow-simmered dish beef tongue cooked with a variety of savory spices and herbs.
Mondongo is a Sunday or special occasion soup that’s bold and beautiful. Made with tripe and bursting with flavor, it’s a dish that dares you to dive deep into local cuisine.
Taxi or Uber in Costa Rica

Official red cabs fare starts at 920 CRC first KM then 920 CRC per KM, this is usually the expensive way to move around the country (specially at the airport), there are 2 private transport apps available on the country, Uber and Didi. These are not legal here, but it is the most used shuttle and way more inexpensive that red cabs. You could also ask for a private shuttle but please double check with Uber to make sure you are getting a good price or you could get scammed
In Costa Rica official phone number for emergencies is 911, if you got somehow an emergency like losing your passport use the link below to find out your embassy contact information
